FacilityName: Palo Verde County Water District/Treatment Plant
DeregistrationReasonOtherText: We only have 600 lbs of CL2 capacity at any time.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Water treatment & distribution plant is very small area with one full-time employee and one weekend part-time employee. Both employee are very knowledgeable about the plant and the location of all emergency equipment/response plan/MSDS. Office personnel, as well as plant employee's work together and train together in the event of an emergency. Fire Department Personnel also are involved in training and working with the employees and have assisted the District with numerous main line breaks. The FD is also given updated emergency response plans as well as all MSDS updates and have taken several tours of the plant in the event of a chlorine spill. This is a very small community and everyone works well together and are willing to assist in any emergency situation.

 
PALO VERDE COUNTY WATER DISTRICT
1065 Desert View-PO Box 185    
Palo Verde, CA. 92266-0185     
Phone 760-854-3519   Fax   760-854-1149
pvwaterworks@earthlink.net 


Water Treatment and Distribution Information


The Palo Verde County Water District Treatment and Distribution System was built in 1983 and was put into service in November of that year.

Treatment Plant:

In 1989 a 7,500 gallon Tonka, horizontal filter vessel was added to the system to remove Iron & Manganese.

In the year 2000, the 125,000-gallon storage tank was removed and replaced with two (2) new 125,000-gallon, above ground tanks. The two tanks are plumbed together and are in use at the same time.

The two (2) wells (north well & south well) run on a 30,000-gallon cycle, therefore the system always has a 220,000-gallon reserve in storage.

The two (2) Booster Pumps rotate in normal use. If the PSI drops below 40 PSI, the two (2) pumps run in tandem.

Distribution System:

All of the Hydrants are the same, six inch (6?) Clow 850, with 2?? and 4? outlets, branched off at 8? and 6? mains with a 6? gate valve before each hydrant.

1. Supply Wells

a. Number 2                     North well, south well
                                                    b. Depth, feet                       70?             90?
                                                    c. Capacity GPM (each)                  300

6. Hydro pneumat

ic Tank               a. Number                                       1
